meanings.def: to make a connection between people or things in your mind
examples: associate somebody/something with somebody/something I always associate the smell of baking with my childhood.
He is closely associated in the public mind with horror movies.
Most people immediately associate addictions with drugs, alcohol and cigarettes.
associate somebody/something You wouldn’t normally associate these two writers—their styles are completely different.

meanings.def: to spend time with somebody, especially a person or people that somebody else does not approve of
examples: I don't like you associating with those people.

meanings.def: to show that you support or agree with something
examples: I associate myself with the prime minister's remarks (= I agree with them).
I have never associated myself with political extremism.

meanings.def: of a lower rank; having fewer rights in a particular profession or organization
examples: associate membership of the European Union
She was only the associate producer of the movie.

meanings.def: joined to or connected with a profession or an organization
a person that you work with, do business with or spend a lot of time with
examples: The company is called Landor Associates.
He was known to be one of the convicted man’s associates.

meanings.def: a person who has an Associate’s degree (= one that is given after completing two years of study at a junior college)
